New Records: The Cavaliers set a franchise record for points in a quarter with 49 in the first.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell opened the fourth quarter with a 3-pointer and scored Cleveland's first nine points of the period.
He had 18 in the last 12 minutes.
The Cavaliers blitzed the Bulls 21-7 the rest of the way.
Pre-Game Insights: It doesn't matter (where the game is played) for the Cavaliers, they're playing with energy and a connectivity that's only building their confidence and trust in Atkinson.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers continued one of the best starts in league history, improving to 14-0 with a 144-126 win over the Chicago Bulls on Friday night in an NBA Cup game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers are the sixth team to go 14-0 and first since the Golden State Warriors opened 24-0 in 2015-16.
Cleveland's 14-game winning streak is the longest in the club's 55-year existence.
Others: The Bulls played without Nikola Vucevic, who was out due to an illness.
The Cavaliers played without starting forward Evan Mobley, who has been battling an illness the past few days.
